lines.gurmukhi: 1 gurmuK mnmuK
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK mnmuiK jwxIAin swD AswD jgq vrqwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Manamoukhi Jaaneeani Saadh Asaadh Jagat Varataaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From their conduct in the world, the Guru-oriented, gurmukhs and mind oriented manmukhs are known sadhus and wicked ones respectively.

lines.gurmukhi: duh ivic duKI dubwjry KrbV hoey KudI KuAwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Duh Vichi Doukhee Doubaajaray Kharabarh Hoay Khudee Khuaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Out of these two, the mongrels-apparently sadhus but internally thieves--are always in wavering state and, suffering for their ego, go astray.

lines.gurmukhi: duhIN srweIN jrdrU dgy durwhy cor cugwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Duheen Saraaeen Jarad Roo Dagay Duraahay Chor Chougaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Such double-faced thieves, backbiters and cheats remain pale-faced due to their bewilderment in both the worlds.

lines.gurmukhi: nw aurvwru n pwru hY goqy Kwin Brmu isir Bwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Naa Uraavaru N Paaru Hai Gotay Khaani Bharamu Siri Bhaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: They are neither here nor there and, burdened with the load of delusions go on drowing in between and getting suffocated.

lines.gurmukhi: ihMdU muslmwn ivic gurmuiK mnmuiK ivc gubwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Hindoo Mousalamaan Vichi Guramoukhi Manamoukhi Vich Goubaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Whether Muslim or the Hindu, the manmukh among the gurmukhs is the utter darkness.

lines.gurmukhi: jMmxu mrxu sdw isir mwrw ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Janmanu Maranu Sadaa Siri Bhaaraa ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: His head is always loaded with the comings and goings through transmigration of his soul.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 ihMdU muslmwn

Shabad OS B.translation: Hindu-Muslim

lines.gurmukhi: duhu imil jMmy duie jxy duhu jixAwN duie rwh clwey
lines.transliteration_english: Duhu Mili Janmay Dui Janay Duhu Janiaan Dui Raah Chalaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Consequent to the confluence of male and female both (Hindu and Muslim) were born; but both initiated separate ways (sects).

lines.gurmukhi: ihMdU AwKin rwm rwm muslmwxwN nwau Kudwey
lines.transliteration_english: Hindoo Aakhani Raam Raamu Mousalamaanaan Naau Khudaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Hindus remember Ram-Ram and the Muslims named Him Khuda.

lines.gurmukhi: ihMdU pUrib sauihAwN pCim muslmwx invwey
lines.transliteration_english: Hindoo Poorabi Sauhiaan Pachhami Mousalamaanu Nivaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Hindus perform their worship facing East and Muslims bow towards the West.

lines.gurmukhi: gMg bnwris ihMdUAwN mkw muslmwxu mnwey
lines.transliteration_english: Gang Banaarasi Hindooaan Makaa Mousalamaanu Manaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Hindus adore Ganges and Banaras, whereas Muslims celebrate Mecca.

lines.gurmukhi: vyd kqybw cwir cwir cwr vrn cwir mjhb clwey
lines.transliteration_english: Vayd Kataybaan Chaari Chaari Chaar Varan Chaari Majahab Chalaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They have four scriptures each--four Vedas and four Katebas. Hindus created four varnas (castes) and Muslims the four sects (Hanifis, Safis, Malikis, and Hambalis).

lines.gurmukhi: pMj qq dovY jxy pauxu pwxI bYsMqru Cwey
lines.transliteration_english: Panj Tat Dovai Janay Paounu Paanee Baisantaru Chhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: But in fact, the same air, water and fire exist in them all.

lines.gurmukhi: iek QwauN duie nwauN Drwey ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Daaoun Dui Naaoun Dharaaay ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: The ultimate shelter for both is the same one; only they have given different names to it.

lines.gurmukhi: 3 dubwjrw, AwrsI dw diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of double-talker and the double-faced mirror,

lines.gurmukhi: dyiK duiBqI AwrsI mjls hQo hQI ncY
lines.transliteration_english: Daykhi Doubhitee Aarasee Majalas Hado Hadee Nachai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Double-faced i.e. uneven minor moves hand to hand in the assembly (because nobody likes it).

lines.gurmukhi: duKo duKu dubwjrI Gir Gir iPrY prweI KcY
lines.transliteration_english: Doukho Doukhu Doubaajaree Ghari Ghari Dhirai Paraaee Khachai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly a double-talker like a prostitute engrossed in other's homes moves from door to door.

lines.gurmukhi: Ago hoie suhwvxI muih ifTY mwxs chmcY
lines.transliteration_english: Agai Hoi Suhaavanee Muhi Ditdai Maanas Chahamachai.

Shabad OS B.translation: At first she looks pretty and men are pleased to see her face

lines.gurmukhi: ipChu dyiK frwvxI ieko muhu duhu ijnis ivrcY
lines.transliteration_english: Pichhahu Daykhi Daraavanee Iko Muhu Duhu Jinasi Virachai.

Shabad OS B.translation: But later she is found to be dreadful because her single face possesses two images.

lines.gurmukhi: Kyih pwie muhu mwNjIAY iPir iPir mYlu BrY rMig kcY
lines.transliteration_english: Khayhi Paai Muhu Maanjeeai Dhiri Dhiri Mailu Rangi Kachai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even cleaned with ashes, such double-faced mirror becomes filthy again.

lines.gurmukhi: Drmrwie jmu ieku hY Drmu ADrmu n Brm prcY
lines.transliteration_english: Dharamaraai Jamu Iku Hai Dharamu Adharamu N Bharamu Parachai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Yama, the Lord of dharma is one; he accepts dharma but does not get pleased by the delusions of wickedness.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK jwie imlY scu scY ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Jaai Milai Sachu Sachai ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: Truthful gurmukhs ultimately attain the truth.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 gur isK prDwn hY qy mYqRI krwauxw eys dw kMm hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Sikh of the Guru is superior

lines.gurmukhi: vuxY julwhw qMdu gMiF ieku sUqu kir qwxw vwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Vounai Julaahaa Tandu Ganddhi Iku Sootu Kari Taanaa Vaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: By tying the threads, weaver weaves huge warp and weft with a single yarn.

lines.gurmukhi: drjI pwiV ivgwVdw pwtw mul n lhY ivkwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Darajee Paarhi Vigaarhadaa Paataa Mul N Lahai Vikaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Tailor tears and spoils cloth and torn cloth cannot be sold.

lines.gurmukhi: kqrix kqrY kqrxI hoie dumUhI cVHdI swxw
lines.transliteration_english: Katarani Katarai Kataranee Hoi Doumoohee Charhhadee Saanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: His double-blade honed scissors cuts the cloth.

lines.gurmukhi: sUeI sIvY joiV kY ivCuiVAwN kir myil imlwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Sooee Seevai Jorhi Kai Vichhurhiaan Kari Mayli Milaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: On the other hand, his needle stiches and the separated pieces are thus reunited.

lines.gurmukhi: swihbu ieko rwih duie jg ivic ihMdU muslmwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Saahibu Iko Raahi Dui Jag Vichi Hindoo Mousalamaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: That Lord is one but different ways have been created by Hindus and Muslims.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI prDwnu hY pIr murIdI hY prvwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikhee Paradhaanu Hai Peer Mureedee Hai Paravaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The path of Sikhism is superior to both because it accepts an intimate relation between the Guru and the Sikh.

lines.gurmukhi: duKI dubwjirAwN hYrwxw ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Doukhee Doubaajariaan Hairaanaa ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: The double-minded are always perplexed and thus they suffer.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 dubwjrw-crKw diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: The-double-talker compared with the spinningwheel-

lines.gurmukhi: ijau crKw ATKMBIAw duih lTI dy mMiJ mMJyrU
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Charakhaa Atdakhanbheeaa Duhi Latdee Day Manjhi Manjhayroo.

Shabad OS B.translation: The eight board spinningwheel moves between two upright posts.

lines.gurmukhi: duie isr Dir duhu KuMF ivic isr igrdwn iPrY lKPyrU
lines.transliteration_english: Dui Siri Dhari Duhu Khounddh Vichi Sir Giradaan Dhirai Lakh Dhayroo.

Shabad OS B.translation: Both ends of its axle are thrust in the holes in the middle of two post and on the force of its neck the wheel is turned innumerable times.

lines.gurmukhi: bwieVu pwie plytIAY mwlH vtwie pwieAw Gt GyrU
lines.transliteration_english: Baairhu Paai Palayteeai Maalh Vataai Paaiaa Ghat Ghayroo.

Shabad OS B.translation: The two sides are secured by a fastening cord and a string belt encircles the wheel and the spindle.

lines.gurmukhi: duhu crmK ivic qRklw kqin kuVIAwN icVIAwN hyrU
lines.transliteration_english: Duhu Charamakh Vichi Trakulaa Katani Kurheeaan Chirheeaan Hayroo.

Shabad OS B.translation: Two pieces of leather hold the spindle around which the girls spin sitting in groups.

lines.gurmukhi: qiRM\\\\ix bih auT jwNdIAwN ijau ibrKhu auif jwin pMKyrU
lines.transliteration_english: Trinnee Bahi Outd Jaandeeaan Jiu Birakhahu Udi Jaani Pankhayroo.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sometimes they would suddenly stop spinning and leave as birds fly from the tree (the double-minded person is also like these girls or birds and changes his mind abruptly).

lines.gurmukhi: EiV inbwhU nw QIAY kcw rMgu rMgwieAw gyrU
lines.transliteration_english: Aorhi Nibaahoo Naa Deeai Kachaa Rangu Rangaaiaa Gayroo.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ochre colour which is temporary one, does not give company up to the last i.e. it fades away after sometime.

lines.gurmukhi: GuMim GumMdI Cwau GuvyrU ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Ghounmi Ghoumandee Chhaau Ghavayroo ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: The double-minded person (also) is like a moving shadow which does not stick to one place

lines.gurmukhi: 6 dubwjrw dUeI ivBcwrx iesqRI

Shabad OS B.translation: The fickle-minded and the adulteress woman

lines.gurmukhi: swhuru pIhru plrY hoie inlj n ljw DovY
lines.transliteration_english: Saahuru Peeharu Palarai Hoi Nilaj N Lajaa Dhovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Abandoning both the families of father and father-in-laws, the shameless woman cares not for modesty and does not wish to wash away her immoral reputation.

lines.gurmukhi: rwvY jwru Bqwru qij iKMjoqwix KusI ikau hovY
lines.transliteration_english: Raavai Jaaru Bhataaru Taji Khinjotaani Khousee Kiu Hovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Deserting her husband, if she enjoys the company of her paramour, how can she, moving in different lustful directions, be happy?

lines.gurmukhi: smJweI nw smJhI mrxy prxy loku ivgovY
lines.transliteration_english: Samajhaaee Naa Samajhaee Maranay Paranay Loku Vigovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: No advice prevails upon her and she is despised at all social gatherings of mourning and rejoicing.

lines.gurmukhi: iDir iDir imldy myhxy huie srimMdI AMJU rovY
lines.transliteration_english: Dhiri Dhiri Miladay Mayhanay Hui Saramindee Anjhoo Rovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: She weeps in contrition because she is disdaifully reproached at every door.

lines.gurmukhi: pwp kmwxy pkVIAY hwix kwix dIbwix KVovY
lines.transliteration_english: Paap Kamaanay Pakarheeai Haani Kaani Deebaani Kharhovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: For her sins, she is arrested and punished by the court where she loses every iota of honour that she had.

lines.gurmukhi: mrY n jIvY duK shY rhY n Gr ivic pr Gr jovY
lines.transliteration_english: Marai N Jeevai Doukh Sahai Rahai N Ghari Vichi Par Ghar Jovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: She is miserable because now she is neither dead nor alive; she still looks for another house to ruin because she does not like to live in her own home.

lines.gurmukhi: duibDw Avgux hwru provY ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Doubidhaa Aougoun Haaru Parovai ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly doubt or double-mindedness weaves for it the garland of vices.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 duAYq qy is`K

Shabad OS B.translation: Sense of duality and Sikh

lines.gurmukhi: ijau bysIvY Qyhu kir pCoqwvY suiK nw vsY
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Bayseevai Dayhu Kari Pachhotaavai Soukhi Naa Vasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Inhabiting in other's lands brings repentence and takes away happiness;

lines.gurmukhi: ciV ciV lVdy BUmIey DwVw pyVw Ksx KsY
lines.transliteration_english: Charhi Charhi Larhaday Bhoomeeay Dhaarhaa Payrhaa Khasan Khasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Daily the land lords quarrel, toot and extort.

lines.gurmukhi: duh nwrI dw dUlhw duh munsw dI nwir ivxsY
lines.transliteration_english: Duh Naaree Daa Valahaa Duhu Mounasaa Dee Naari Vinasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Husband of two women and the wife of two husbands are bound to perish;

lines.gurmukhi: huie aujwVw KyqIAY duih hwkm duie hukmu KuxsY
lines.transliteration_english: Hui Ujaarhaa Khayteeai Duhi Haakam Dui Houkamu Khounasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Tillage under the orders of two mutually antagonist masters would go waste.

lines.gurmukhi: duK duie icMqw rwiq idhu Gru iCjY vYrwiexu hsY
lines.transliteration_english: Doukh Dui Chintaa Raati Dihu Gharu Chhijai Vairaainu Hasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Where suffering and anxiety dwell day and night i.e. all the time, that house gets destroyed and the neighbourhood women laugh derisively.

lines.gurmukhi: duhu KuMFwN ivic riK isru vsdI vsY n nsdI nsY
lines.transliteration_english: Duhu Khounddhaan Vichi Rakhi Siru Vasadee Vasai N Nasadee Nasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If one gets one's head stuck in two cavities, one can neither stay nor run away.

lines.gurmukhi: dUjw Bwau BuieAMgmu fsY ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Doojaa Bhaau Bhuiangamu Dasai ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: Likewise, the sense of duality is a virtual snake-bite.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 mnmuK srp

Shabad OS B.translation: Manmukh and a snake

lines.gurmukhi: duKIAw dustu dubwjrw spu dumUhw burw buirAweI
lines.transliteration_english: Doukheeaa Dousatu Doubaajaraa Sapu Doumoohaa Buraa Buriaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The wicked and unhappy is the betrayer who is like two headed snake which is also undesirable.

lines.gurmukhi: sBdUM mMdI sp join spwN ivic kujwiq kuBweI
lines.transliteration_english: Sabh Doon Mandee Sap Joni Sapaan Vichi Kujaati Koubhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Snake's is the worst species and out of that also the two-headed snake is a bad and wicked variety.

lines.gurmukhi: koVI hoAw goip gur ingury qMqu n mMqu suKweI
lines.transliteration_english: Korhee Hoaa Gopi Gur Niguray Tantu N Mantu Soukhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Its master remains unknown and on this unprincipled creature no mantra works.

lines.gurmukhi: koVI hovY lVY ijs ivgV rUip hoie mir shmweI
lines.transliteration_english: Korhee Hovai Larhai Jis Vigarh Roopi Hoi Mari Sahamaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Any one whom it bites becomes leper. His face is deformed and he dies of its fear.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK mnmuiK bwhrw lwqo lwvw lwie buJweI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Manamoukhi Baaharaa Laato Laavaa Laai Bujhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Manmukh, the mind-oriented one does not accept the advice of gurmukhs and creates quarrel here and there.

lines.gurmukhi: iqsu ivhu vwiq kulwiq min AMdir gxqI qwiq prweI
lines.transliteration_english: Tisu Vihu Vaati Kulaati Mani Andari Ganatee Taati Paraaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: His speech is poisonous and in his mind are cherished sordid plans and jealousies.

lines.gurmukhi: isr icQY ivhu bwix n jweI ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Sir Chidai Vihu Baani N Jaaee ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: His poisonous habit does not go even when his head is crushed.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 vySvw dw diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of a prostitute

lines.gurmukhi: ijau bhu imqI vysuAw CfY Ksmu inKsmI hoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Bahu Mitee Vaysuaa Chhadai Khasamu Nikhasamee Hoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: A prostitute having many lovers leaves her husband and thus becomes unclaimed masterless.

lines.gurmukhi: puqu jxy jy vysuAw nwnik dwdik nwau n koeI
lines.transliteration_english: Poutu Janay Jay Vaysuaa Naanaki Daadaki Naaoun N Koee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If she gives birth to a son, he carries no maternal or paternal name with hint

lines.gurmukhi: nrik svwir sIgwirAw rwg rMg Cil ClY CloeI
lines.transliteration_english: Naraki Savaari Seegaariaa Raag Rang Chhali Chhalai Chhaloee.

Shabad OS B.translation: She is a decorated and ornamental hell which deceives people by loving apparent charm and grace.

lines.gurmukhi: GMfwhyVu AhyVIAwN mwxs imrg ivxwhu sQoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Ghandaahayrhu Ahayrheeaan Maanas Mirag Vinaahu Sadoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the hunter's pipe attractes the deer, so do the songs of a prostitute allure men to their destruction.

lines.gurmukhi: eyQY mrY hrwm hoie AgY drgh imlY n FoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Aydai Marai Haraam Hoi Agai Daragah Milai N Ddhoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Here in this world she dies an evil death and hereafter obtains no enterance into God's court.

lines.gurmukhi: duKIAw dustu dubwjrw jwx rupeIAw myKI soeI
lines.transliteration_english: Doukheeaa Dousatu Doubaajaraa Jaan Roupaeeaa Maykhee Soee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Similar to her, who adheres not to one person the double-talker cunningly following two religious masters is always unhappy and like a fake rupee is exposed at the counter.

lines.gurmukhi: ivgVY Awip ivgwVY loeI ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Vigarhai Aapi Vigaarhai Loee ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: Ruined himself he ruins others.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 dubwjrw

Shabad OS B.translation: The dual-natured

lines.gurmukhi: vix vix kwau n soheI Krw isAwxw hoie ivguqw
lines.transliteration_english: Vani Vani Kaaoun N Sohaee Kharaa Siaanaa Hoi Vigoutaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: For crow wandering from forest to forest is no merit though it considers itself very clever.

lines.gurmukhi: cuqiV imtI ijsu lgY jwxY Ksm kumHwrw kuqw
lines.transliteration_english: Choutarhi Mitee Jisu Lagai Jaanai Khasam Koumhaaraan Koutaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Dog having mud spots on the buttocks is at once recognised as a potter's pet.

lines.gurmukhi: bwbwxIAw khwxIAw Gir Gir bih bih krin kupuqw
lines.transliteration_english: Baabaaneeaan Kahaaneeaan Ghari Ghari Bahi Bahi Karani Koupoutaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Unworthy sons tell everywhere about the feats of forefathers (but do nothing themselves).

lines.gurmukhi: AwgU hoie muhwiedw swQu Cif caurwhy suqw
lines.transliteration_english: Aagoo Hoi Muhaaidaa Saadu Chhadi Chauraahay Soutaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: A leader who goes to sleep at the crossroads, gets his companions robbed (of their belongings).

lines.gurmukhi: jMmI swK aujwVdw gilAw syqI mIh kuruqw
lines.transliteration_english: Janmee Saakh Ujaarhadaa Galiaan Saytee Maynhu Kuroutaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Unseasonal rain and hail destroy the well rooted crop.

lines.gurmukhi: duKIAw dustu dubwjrw Ktru bldu ijvY hiljuqw
lines.transliteration_english: Doukheeaa Dousatu Doubaajaraa Khataru Baladu Jivai Hali Joutaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The suffering double talker is similar to a stubborn plaughing ox (who always gets whipped).

lines.gurmukhi: fim fim swnu aujwVI muqw ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Dami Dami Saanu Ujaarhee Moutaa ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: Ultimately such an ox is branded and abandoned in desolate places.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 dubwjrw duKIAw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Double talker is sorrowful

lines.gurmukhi: duKIAw dustu dubwjrw qwmy rMghu kYhw hovY
lines.transliteration_english: Doukheeaa Dousatu Doubaajaraa Taamay Rangahu Kaihaan Hovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The evil double-talker is copper which looks like bronze.

lines.gurmukhi: bwhru idsY aujlw AMdir msu n DopY DovY
lines.transliteration_english: Baaharu Disai Ujalaa Andari Masu N Dhopai Dhovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Apparently, the bronze looks bright but even persisting washing cannot clean its inner blackness.

lines.gurmukhi: sMnI jwxu luhwr dI hoie dumUhIN kusMg ivgovY
lines.transliteration_english: Sannee Jaanu Luhaar Dee Hoi Doumooheen Kousang Vigovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The pliers of blacksmith is double mouthed but being in the bad company (of the blacksmith) it destroys itself.

lines.gurmukhi: iKxu qqI Awrix vVY iKxu TMFI jlu AMdir tovY
lines.transliteration_english: Khanu Tatee Aarani Varhai Khanu Tdaddhee Jalu Andari Tovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: It goes in the hot furnance and the next moment it is put in cold water.

lines.gurmukhi: qumw idsy sohxw icqRimqwlw ivsu ivlovY
lines.transliteration_english: Toumaa Disay Sohanaa Chitramitaalaa Visu Vilovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The colocynth gives a beautiful, piebald look but inside it remains poison.

lines.gurmukhi: swau n kauVw sih skY jIBY CwlY AMJU rovY
lines.transliteration_english: Saau N Kaurhaa Sahi Sakai Jeebhai Chhaalai Anjhoo Rovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Its bitter taste cannot be tolerated; it blisters the tongue and causes tears to trickle.

lines.gurmukhi: klI knyr n hwir provY ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Kalee Kanayr N Haari Parovai ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: No garland is prepared of the oleander buds (for their being devoid of fragrance).

lines.gurmukhi: 12 dUjw Bwau hwr dyNdw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Sense of duality brings defeat

lines.gurmukhi: duKI dust dubwjrw suqr murg hoie kMim n AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Doukhee Dousatu Doubaajaraa Soutar Muragu Hoi Kanm N Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The evil person who is double-talker is always unhappy and is useless like an ostrich.

lines.gurmukhi: aufix aufY n ldIAY pursus hoeI Awpu lKwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Udani Udai N Ladeeai Purasous Hoee Aapu Lakhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: An ostrich can neither fly nor can be laden, but it strutts ostentatiously.

lines.gurmukhi: hsqI dMd vKwxIAin horu idKwlY horqu KwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Hasatee Dand Vakhaaneeani Horu Dikhaalai Horatu Khaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The elephant has one set of teeth for display and another for eating.

lines.gurmukhi: bkrIAwN no cwr Qx duie gl ivic duie lyvY lwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Bakareeaan No Chaar Danu Dui Gal Vichi Dui Layvai Laavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Goats have four teats, two on their necks and two attached to their udders.

lines.gurmukhi: ieknI duDu smwvdw iek TgwaU Tg TgwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Ikanee Dudhu Samaavadaa Ik Tdagaaoo Tdagi Tdagaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The latter contain milk, the former deceive those who expect milk from them.

lines.gurmukhi: morwN AKI cwir cwir auie dyKin EnI idis n AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Moraan Akhee Chaari Chaari Ui Daykhani Aonee Disi N Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Peacocks have four eyes through which they behold but others know nothing about them.

lines.gurmukhi: dUjw Bwau kudwau hrwvY ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Doojaa Bhaau Kudaau Haraavai ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: So turning one's attention to two masters (religions) leads to disastrous failure.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 dÍYq qoN swVw

Shabad OS B.translation: The duality scorches one and all

lines.gurmukhi: dMml vjY duhu iDrI Kwie qmwcy bMDin jiVAw
lines.transliteration_english: Danmalu Vajai Duhu Dhiree Khaai Tamaachay Bandhani Jarhiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Two-faced drum roped all around is beaten from both the sides.

lines.gurmukhi: vjin rwg rbwb ivic kMn mroVI iPir iPir PiVAw
lines.transliteration_english: Vajani Raag Rabaab Vichi Kann Marorhee Dhiri Dhiri Dharhiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Musical measures are played on rebeck but time and again its pegs are twisted.

lines.gurmukhi: Kwn mjIry tkrwN isr qn BMin mrdy kir DiVAw
lines.transliteration_english: Khaan Majeeray Takaraan Siri Tan Bhanni Maraday Kari Dharhiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Cymbals being paired strike each other and smash their heads and bodies.

lines.gurmukhi: KwlI vjY vMJulI dy sUlwk n AMdir viVAw
lines.transliteration_english: Khaalee Vajai Vanjhulee Day Soolaak N Andari Varhiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The flute when empty from inside definitely chimes but when any other object enters into it (i.e. when duality enters it) an iron rod is pushed in it to clear it (it is put to trouble).

lines.gurmukhi: suieny klsu svwrIAY BMnw Gtw n jweI GiVAw
lines.transliteration_english: Suinay Kalasu Savaareeai Bhannaa Gharhaa N Jaaee Gharhiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The golden vessel is got repaired but broken mud-pitcher is not formed again.

lines.gurmukhi: dUjw Bwau sVwxY siVAw ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Doojaa Bhaau Sarhaanai Sarhiaa ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: Engrossed in duality the individual putrefies and is scorched for ever.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 dubwjrw suDrdw nhIN

Shabad OS B.translation: Dual-minded never improves

lines.gurmukhi: duKIAw dustu dubwjrw bgul smwiD rhY iek tMgw
lines.transliteration_english: Doukheeaa Dousatu Doubaajaraa Bagul Samaadhi Rahai Ik Tangaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: An evil and dual-minded person suffers like the crane standing on one leg.

lines.gurmukhi: bjr pwp n auqrin Guit Guit jIAwN Kwie ivic gMgw
lines.transliteration_english: Bajar Paap N Outarani Ghouti Ghouti Jeeaan Khaai Vichi Gangaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Standing in Ganges, it strangulates creatures to eat them and its sins are never washed out.

lines.gurmukhi: qIrQ nwvY qUMbVI qir qir qnu DovY kir nMgw
lines.transliteration_english: Teerad Naavai Toonbarhee Tari Tari Tanu Dhovai Kari Nagaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Colocynth may swim naked and bath at one pilgrimage centre after another,

lines.gurmukhi: mn ivic vsY kwlkUtu Brmu n auqrY krmu kuFMgw
lines.transliteration_english: Man Vichi Vasai Kaalakootu Bharamu N Outarai Karamu Kuddhangaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: But its action are so crooked that the poison in its heart never goes.

lines.gurmukhi: vrmI mwrI nw mrY bYTw jwie pqwil BuieAMgw
lines.transliteration_english: Varamee Maaree Naa Marai Baitdaa Jaai Pataali Bhuiangaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Beating the hole of a snake does not kill it, for it remains (safe)  in the nether world.

lines.gurmukhi: hsqI nIir nvwlIAY inkil Kyh aufwey AMgw
lines.transliteration_english: Hasatee Neeri Navaaleeai Nikali Khayh Udaaay Angaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The elephant coming out of water after a bath, again blows dust around its limbs.

lines.gurmukhi: dUjw Bwau suAwau n cMgw ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Doojaa Bhaau Suaaao N Changaa ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: The sense of duality is not at all a good sense.

lines.gurmukhi: 15 dubwjry dw AMq

Shabad OS B.translation: The end of the dual-minded

lines.gurmukhi: dUjw Bwau dubwjrw mn pwtY KrbwVU KIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Doojaa Bhaau Doubaajaraa Man Paatai Kharabaarhoo Kheeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mind of the dual-faced is like useless sour milk.

lines.gurmukhi: Aghu imTw hoie imlY ipChu kauVw doKu srIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Agahu Mitdaa Hoi Milai Pichhahu Kaurhaa Dokhu Sareeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: On drinking it at first it tastes sweet but then its taste is bitter and it makes body diseased.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau bhu imqw kvl Pulu bhu rMgI bMniH ipMfu AhIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Bahu Mitaa Kaval Phulu Bahu Rangee Bannhi Pindu Aheeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The double talker is that black bee which is friend of flowers but like fools supposes those flowers to be its permanent home.

lines.gurmukhi: hirAw iqlu bUAwV ijau klI knyr durMg n DIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Hariaa Tilu Booaarh Jiu Kalee Kanayr Durang N Dheeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Green but internally hallo sesame seed and the oleander bud have neither true beauty and colour nor any sensible person considers them of any use.

lines.gurmukhi: jy sau hQw nVu vDY AMdru KwlI vwju nPIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Sau Hadaa Narhu Vadhai Andaru Khaalee Vaaju Nadheeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: If reed grows up to the lenght of hundred hands even then it remains hollow internally producing noisy sound.

lines.gurmukhi: cMnx vws n bohIAin Kih Kih vwNs jlin bypIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Channan Vaas N Boheeani Khahi Khahi Vaans Jalani Baypeeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Despite their juxtaposition with sandal wood tree bamboos donot become fragrant, and destroy themselves by their mutual friction.

lines.gurmukhi: jm dr cotw shw vhIrw ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Jam Dar Chotaa Sahaa Vaheeraa ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such person at the door of Yama, the god of death, bear many a stroke of his rod.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 dubwjro dI inMmRqw bI burI hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Even the humility of a double talker is evil

lines.gurmukhi: dUjw Bwau dubwjrw bDw krY slwmu n BwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Doojaa Bhaau Doubaajaraa Badhaa Karai Salaamu N Bhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The double-talker salutes bound by his compulsions, yet his posture is disliked.

lines.gurmukhi: FINg juhwrI FINgulI gil bDy Ehu sIsu invwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Ddheeng Juhaaree Ddheengulee Gali Badhay Aohu Seesu Nivaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Dhitighalt, a contraption to draw water from a pit or well comprising a wooden pole, bows only when a stone (as a counterweight) is tied to it.

lines.gurmukhi: gil bDY ijau inklY KUhhu pwxI aupir AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Gali Badhai Jiu Nikalai Khoohahu Paanee Oupari Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: On the other hand leather bag when tied only, brings out water from the well.

lines.gurmukhi: bDw ctI jo BrY nw gux nw aupkwru cVHwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Badhaa Chatee Jo Bharai Naa Goun Naa Oupakaaru Charhhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Working under some complusion is neither a merit nor a benevolence.

lines.gurmukhi: invY kmwx dubwjrI ijh PiVdy iek sIs shwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Nivai Kamaan Doubaajaree Jih Dharhiday Ik Sees Sahaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The two ended bow with an arrow on it, bends when pulled, but immediately on release, the arrow discharged strikes the head of someone.

lines.gurmukhi: invY AhyVI imrgu dyiK krY ivswh DRohu sru lwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Nivai Ahorhee Miragu Daykhi Karai Visaah Dhrohu Saru Laavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, the hunter also bows on the sight of a deer and treacherously kills it with his arrow.

lines.gurmukhi: AprwDI AprwDu kmwvY ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Aparaadhee Aparaadhu Kamaavai ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: The criminal, thus, goes on committing crimes.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 dubwjrw Awpy nhIN inauNdw

Shabad OS B.translation: Double-talker does not bow of his own

lines.gurmukhi: invY n qIr dubwjrw gwfI KMB muKI muih lwey
lines.transliteration_english: Nivai N Teer Doubaajaraa Gaadee Khanbh Moukhee Muhi Laaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The double-headed arrow with tip at its head and feathers at the tail does not bend.

lines.gurmukhi: invY n nyjw dumuhw rx ivic aucw Awp gxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Nivai N Nayjaa Doumuhaa Ran Vichi Ouchaa Aapu Ganaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Double-faced spear also never bows and in the war gets itself arrogantly noticed.

lines.gurmukhi: Ast Dwqu dw jbr jMgu invY nw PutY kot Fhwey
lines.transliteration_english: Asat Dhaatu Daa Jabar Jangu Nivai N Dhoutai Kot Ddhahaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Cannon made of eight metals neither bends nor explodes but demolishes the fort.

lines.gurmukhi: invY n KMfw swr dw hoie duDwrw KUn krwey
lines.transliteration_english: Nivai N Khandaa Saar Daa Hoi Dudhaaraa Khoon Karaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Double-edged sword of steel does not break and kills with both edges.

lines.gurmukhi: invY n sUlI GyrxI kir Asvwr Pwhy idvwey
lines.transliteration_english: Nivai N Soolee Ghayranee Kari Asavaar Dhaahay Divaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The encircling noose does not bow but ensnares many a horse-rider.

lines.gurmukhi: invix n sIKwN sKq hoie mwsu proie kbwbu Bunwey
lines.transliteration_english: Nivani N Seekhaan Sakhat Hoi Maasu Paroi Kabaabu Bhounaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Iron rod being hard does not bend but meat pieces stringed on it are roasted.

lines.gurmukhi: ijauN kir Awrw ruKu qCwey ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Jioun Kari Aaraa Roukhu Tachhaaay ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: Likewise, the'straight saw cuts the trees.

lines.gurmukhi: 18 dubwjrw duKdweI

Shabad OS B.translation: Double cross is painfull

lines.gurmukhi: Aku DqUrw Jtulw nIvw hoie n duibDw KoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Aku Dhatooraa Jhatulaa Neevaa Hoi N Doubidhaa Khoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The akk, a poisonous plant of sandy region and thorn- apple though with branches lowered, yet do not discard their dubiety.

lines.gurmukhi: Puil Puil Puly dubwjry ibKu Pl Pil Pil mMdI soeI
lines.transliteration_english: Phuli Phuli Phulay Doubaajaray Bikhu Phal Phali Phali Mandee Soee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The hybrid plants apparently look blossommed but they have poisonous flowers and fruits which make them ill-reputed.

lines.gurmukhi: pIAY n koeI Aku duDu pIqy mrIAY duDu n hoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Peeai N Koee Aku Dudhu Peetay Mareeai Dudhu N Hoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Drinking akk-milk, man dies. How could such secretion be called milk?

lines.gurmukhi: KKVIAwN ivic buFIAwN Pit Pit Cuit Cuit aufin EeI
lines.transliteration_english: Khakharheeaan Vichi Buddheeaan Dhati Dhati Chhouti Chhouti Udani Aoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Out of their parts cotton-like pieces burst out and fly about.

lines.gurmukhi: icqimqwlw Ak iqfu imlY dubwjirAwN ikau FoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Chitamitaalaa Ak Tidu Milai Doubaajariaan Kiu Ddhoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Akkhoppers are also piebald; they too like the double-minded , are nowhere sheltered.

lines.gurmukhi: Kwie DqUrw brlIAY kK cuxMdw vqY loeI
lines.transliteration_english: Khaai Dhatooraa Baraleeai Kakh Chounindaa Vatai Loee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Eating thornapple man goes mad and people see him gathering straw in the world.

lines.gurmukhi: kauVI rqk jyl proeI ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Kaurhee Ratak Jayl Paroee ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: Ratak,small red and black seeds, also get pierced through for making garlands.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 cIl diRStwNq duStqw dw

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of the knavery of pine tree

lines.gurmukhi: vDY cIl EjwV ivic aucY aupir aucI hoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Vadhai Cheel Ujaarh Vichi Ouchai Oupari Ouchee Hoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Pine tree grows in a forest and goes high and higher.

lines.gurmukhi: gMFI jlin muswhry pq Apq n Cuhudw koeI
lines.transliteration_english: Ganddhee Jalani Mousaaharay Pat Apat N Chhuhudaa Koee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Its nodes burn in torches and none touches its scorned leaves.

lines.gurmukhi: Cwau n bhin pMDwxUAw pvY pCwvw itbI toeI
lines.transliteration_english: Chhaaoun N Bahani Pandhaanooaan Pavai Pachhaavaan Tibeen Toee.

Shabad OS B.translation: No passerby sits under its shade because its long shadow falls over rough ground.

lines.gurmukhi: iPMf ijvY Plu PwtIAin GuMGirAwly rulin ploeI
lines.transliteration_english: Dhind Jivai Phalu Dhaateeani Ghounghariaalay Rulani Paloee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Its fruit also bursts forth in curly pieces like that of a ball made of rags and moves around.

lines.gurmukhi: kwTu kukwTu n sih skY pwxI pvxu n Dup n loeI
lines.transliteration_english: Kaatdu Koukaatdu N Sahi Sakai Paanee Pavanu N Dhoup N Loee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Its wood is also not a good one, because it cannot bear water, air, sunshine and heat.

lines.gurmukhi: lgI mUil n ivJvY jldI haumY Aig KVoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Lagee Mooli N Vijhavai Jaladee Haoumain Agi Kharhoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If fire breaks out in pine forest it does not extinguish soon and it further goes on burning itself in the fire of ego.

lines.gurmukhi: vifAweI kir deI ivgoeI ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Vadiaaee Kari Daee Vigoee ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: Giving it big size, God has made it useless and liable to destruction.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 duStqweI BlXweI diRStwNq, iql, sx qy kpwh

Shabad OS B.translation: Examples on knavery and goodness-sesame seed, hemp and cotton  , ,

lines.gurmukhi: iqlu kwlw Pulu aujlw hirAw bUtw ikAw nIswxI
lines.transliteration_english: Tilu Kaalaa Phulu Ujalaa Hariaa Bootaa Kiaa Neesaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: How wonderful it is that the sesame seed is black its flower white and plant is green.

lines.gurmukhi: muFhu viF bxweIAY isr qlvwieAw miJ ibbwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Muddhahu Vaddhi Banaaeeai Sir Talavaaiaa Majhi Bibaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Cutting it from near the root, it is put upsidedown in heap out in the field.

lines.gurmukhi: kir kit pweI JMbIAY qylu iqlIhUM pIVy GwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Kari Kati Paaee Jhanbeeai Taylu Tileehoon Peerhay Ghaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: First it is thrashed on stone and then the sesame seeds are crushed through an oil press. Hemp and cotton have two ways.

lines.gurmukhi: sx kpwh duie rwh kir praupkwr ivkwr ivfwxI
lines.transliteration_english: San Kapaah Dui Raah Kari Paraoupakaar Vikaar Vidaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: One undertakes to perform benevolence and the other feels greatness in adopting evil propensities.

lines.gurmukhi: vyil kqwie vuxweIAY pVdw kjx kpVu pRwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Vayli Kataai Vounaaeeai Parhadaa Kajan Kaparhu Praanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: From cotton, after ginning and spinning, cloth is prepared which covers nudity of the people.

lines.gurmukhi: Kl kFwie vtwie sx rsy bMniHn min srmwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Khal Kaddhaai Vataai San Rasay Bannhani Mani Saramaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Hemp gets its skin peeled off and then ropes are made of it which feel no shame in binding the people.

lines.gurmukhi: dustw dustweI imhmwxI ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Dousataan Dousataaee Mihamaanee ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: Knavery of the knaves is just like guests. It has to depart soon.

lines.gurmukhi: 21 dUjw Bwau ik`kr DRyk vw|UM hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Duality is like acacia and china-berry

lines.gurmukhi: ikkr kMfy DRyk Pl PlIN n PilAw inhPl dyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Kikar Kanday Dharayk Phal Phaleen N Phaliaa Nihaphal Dayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Thorns grow on acacia and flowers and fruits on china-berry but they all are useless.

lines.gurmukhi: rMg ibrMgI duhw Pul dwK n guCw kpt snyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Rang Birangee Duhaan Phul Daakh Naa Gouchhaa Kapat Sanayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Both have colourful fruits but they cannot be mistaken for the bunch of grapes.

lines.gurmukhi: icqimqwlw ArMf Plu QoQI Qohir Aws iknyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Chitamitaalaa Arind Phalu Dodee Dohari Aas Kinayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Fruit of castor is also beautiful and piebald but what can one expect from vacuos cactus?

lines.gurmukhi: rqw Plu n mulu AFu inhPl isml Cwv ijvyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Rataa Phul N Mulu Addhu Nihaphal Simal Chhaanv Jivayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Its red fruit is worthless just like the useless shade of silk-cotton tree.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau nlIeyr kTor Plu muh BMny dy grI iqvyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Naleeayr Katdor Phalu Muhu Bhannay Day Garee Tivayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The hard coconut yields its kernel only after its mouth is smashed. Mulberries are of white and black variety and their tastes are also different.

lines.gurmukhi: sUqu kpUq spUq dUq kwly Dauly qUq ievyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Sootu Kapootu Soupootu Doot Kaalay Dhaulay Toot Ivayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, the worthy and the unworthy sons are obedient and rebellious respectively, i.e. one provides happiness whereas the other one gives suffering.

lines.gurmukhi: dUjw Bwau kudwau DryhI ]21]
lines.transliteration_english: Doojaa Bhaau Kudaau Dharayhee ?21?

Shabad OS B.translation: Duality is always a bad policy of life.

lines.gurmukhi: 22 dubwjrw pny dw ielwj

Shabad OS B.translation: Cure for duality

lines.gurmukhi: ijau mix kwly sp isir hishis risris dyie n jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Mani Kaalay Sap Siri Hasi Hasi Rasi Rasi Dayi N Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The snake has jewel in its head but it knows not to yield it willingly i.e. for getting it, it has to be killed..

lines.gurmukhi: jwxu kQUrI imrg qin jIvidAwN ikau koeI AwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaanu Kadooree Mirag Tani Jeevadiaan Kioun Koee Aanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Likewise how can the musk of a deer be obtained while it is alive.

lines.gurmukhi: Awrix lohw qweIAY GVIAY ijauN vgdy vwdwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Aarani Lohaa Taaeeai Gharheeai Jiu Vagaday Vaadaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The furnace, only heats the iron, but a desired and fixed shape is given to iron only by hammering it.

lines.gurmukhi: sUrxu mwrix swDIAY Kwih slwih purK prvwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Sooranu Maarani Saadheeai Khaahi Salaahi Purakh Paravaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Tuberous root yam becomes acceptable to the eaters and praised only after it has been refined with spices.

lines.gurmukhi: pwn supwrI kQu imil cUny rMg surMg is\\\\wxY
lines.transliteration_english: Paan Soupaaree Kadu Mili Choonay Rangu Surangu Siaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Betal leaf, betelnut, catechu and lime, when mixed together are identified by the beautiful colour of the mixture..

lines.gurmukhi: AauKDu hovY kwlkUtu mwir jIvwlin vYd sujwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Aoukhadhu Hovai Kaalakootu Maari Jeevaalani Vaid Sujaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Poison in the hands of a physician becomes a medicine and animates the dead ones.

lines.gurmukhi: mnu pwrw gurmuiK vis AwxY ]22]33]
lines.transliteration_english: Manu Paaraa Guramoukhi Vasi Aanai ?22?33?taytee?

Shabad OS B.translation: Unstable mercurial mind can be controlled by gurmukh alone.

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: crn kml Bij kml pRgws Bey drs drs smdrs idKwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kamal Bhaji Kamal Pragaas Bhaay , Daras Daras Samadaras Dikhaaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By taking refuge of Sat guru's lotus feet, a devotee's mind )0 blooms like lotus flower. By the blessings of a True Guru, he treats and conducts himself alike with all and sundry. He carries no rancour for anyone.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq Anhd ilvlIn Bey Enmn mgn ggn pur Cwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Anahad Livaleen Bhaay , Aonaman Magan Gagan Pur Chhaaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such Guru-conscious person attaches his mind in the unstruck celestial music and enjoying heavenley bliss, rests his mind in the Dasam Duar.

lines.gurmukhi: pRym rs bis huie ibsm ibdyh Bey Aiq Ascrj mo hyrq ihrwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Praym Ras Basi Hui Bisam Bidayh Bhaay , Ati Asacharaj Mo Hayrat Hiraaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Enamoured by the love of Lord, he does not remain conscious of his body any more. This is such a wondrous state that surprises everyone.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suKPl mihmw AgwiD boiD AkQ kQw ibnod khq n Awey hY ]33]
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Soukhaphal Mahimaa Agaadhi Bodhi , Akad Kadaa Binod Kahat N Aaay Hai ?33?

Shabad OS B.translation: The spiritually ecstatic state of a Guru's disciple cannot even be praised. It is beyond contemplation and indescribable too. (33)
